intro: Dithyrea californica, commonly known as the California dithyrea, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, while its flowers are usually white or pale yellow. Dithyrea californica is often found in California and adjacent regions, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
